etymologies: Old English apostol, via ecclesiastical Latin from Greek apostolos ‘messenger’, from apostellein ‘send forth’

notes.text: The twelve Apostles were Peter, Andrew, James, John, Philip, Bartholomew, Thomas, Matthew, James (the Less), Judas (or Thaddaeus), Simon, and Judas Iscariot. After the suicide of Judas Iscariot his place was taken by Matthias

definitions: each of the twelve chief disciples of Jesus Christ.
shortDefinitions: each of twelve chief disciples of Jesus Christ

definitions: an important early Christian teacher or pioneering missionary

examples.text: Kiril and Metodije, the apostles of the Slavs

shortDefinitions: important early Christian teacher or pioneering missionary

definitions: a vigorous and pioneering advocate or supporter of a particular policy, idea, or cause

examples.text: a man once known as the apostle of free-market economics

shortDefinitions: vigorous and pioneering advocate or supporter of particular policy

definitions: one of the twelve administrative officers in a Church of the Latter-day Saints (Mormons).
shortDefinitions: one of twelve administrative officers of Mormon church
